Immigration FAQs
The more you know...

There are various types of visas available for immigration, including investment visas, employment-based visas, humanitarian visas, self-sponsorship visas, and digital nomad visas, each serving different purposes and eligibility criteria.

Several countries, including the USA, UK, Portugal, and Spain, offer investment visas for immigrants who wish to start a business or invest money in the country's economy. These visas often require a minimum investment threshold and specific conditions.

Employment-based visas, available in countries like the USA, UK, Portugal, and Spain, typically require applicants to have a certain level of education, job experience, and sponsorship from an employer. The specific requirements may vary depending on the visa category and country.

Individuals seeking humanitarian protection can explore options such as asylum visas in the USA, UK, Portugal, and Spain. These visas are designed for individuals who have suffered persecution or fear persecution in their home countries due to various reasons such as race, religion, nationality, or political opinion.

Portugal and Spain offer retirement visas and non-lucrative visas for individuals who wish to retire or live comfortably in these countries. These visas typically require proof of financial means and may offer benefits such as access to healthcare and residency rights.

Countries like Portugal and Spain offer specific visas for remote workers or digital nomads who wish to work from these countries. These visas provide flexibility and residence permits for individuals who meet certain income requirements and wish to live and work remotely.

Investment thresholds for investment visas vary depending on the country and visa category. For example, the USA's EB-5 investment visa requires a minimum investment of $1,000,000 or $500,000 in targeted employment areas, while Portugal's D2 visa may have different investment requirements.

Yes, individuals with limited education or job experience may still be eligible for certain visas depending on the country's immigration policies and visa categories. It's essential to explore specific visa options and their requirements to determine eligibility.

The benefits of each type of visa vary but may include residency rights, work authorization, access to healthcare and education, the ability to start a business, and opportunities for personal and professional growth. It's essential to consider individual circumstances and goals when choosing a visa.

The application process for visas varies depending on the country and visa category. Generally, it involves submitting an application form, supporting documents, attending interviews, and meeting specific requirements outlined by the immigration authorities. It's advisable to seek professional assistance or guidance when applying for a visa to ensure a smooth process.

How it works:
Prerequisite
1
Preliminary Checks
Submit a unique and appropriate name for your business entity.
Our team will check for compliance and regulatory norms.
2
Document Preparation
We will help prepare incorporation documents as per the legal requirements of the country you choose.
Once the documents are ready, our team will file it on your behalf with the relevant government authority responsible for business registration or incorporation.
Procedure
3
Approvals & Identification Numbers
Obtaining necessary approvals on your documentation we will apply for the permits and Identification requirements.
4
Corporate Structure & Governance
We will help you define the corporate structure and governance framework suitable for your business.
Draft and adopt bylaws, operating agreements, or articles of association as per the chosen structure.
5
Compliance & Regulatory Requirements
Setting up compliance requirements (corporate bank account, VAT, GST, and other licenses & permits.
Ensure adherence to annual filing obligations, compliance with tax laws, labor laws, and other relevant regulations as per the jurisdiction.
